newsitem.title: UK: Overnight UK cash, gilt repo rates firm.
newsitem.headline: Overnight UK cash, gilt repo rates firm.

text.p: UK overnight cash rates firmed as a shortage of 1.6 billion stg was not fully covered, with late business reported at around 7.0 percent. General collateral (GC) rates followed suit.
* It was an expensive day for cash, with most business done at 5-3/4 percent and little money changing hands at less than 5-11/16
* Bank of England assistance totalled 1.449 billion stg
* Rates at the longer end were also firmer, with one-year money at 6-1/14 1/8.
* FOMC meeting continues to cash a shadow. "If the Fed leaves rates unchanged, things may go off the boil a little here," one trader said.
* GC rates tracked cash, with overnight firming to around 8.0 percent in late business.
* 8.0 percent gilts due 2003 remained the main special stock, trading at between 3.0 and 4.0 percent overnight
* 6.0 percent gilts due 1999 were quoted at about 50 points through GC for one and two weeks
* 7.0 percent gilts 2001 were 75 points through GC for one and two weeks
* 6.75 percent gilts due 2004 were 50 to 60 bp through GC
* Wednesday's auction of 3.0 billion stg of 8.0 percent gilts due 2021 has so far generated little interest in gilt repo market.
* Traders said the market was becoming more jittery about interest rates, with more people viewing a UK rate rise as a possibility in the next few months.
